definitions.definition: used to show movement away from the inside of a place or container:
examples: She opened the window and stuck her head out.

definitions.definition: an excuse or reason for avoiding an unpleasant situation:
examples: We must arrange the negotiations so we have an out if we need it.

definitions.definition: People who are on the outs have argued and are not now friendly with each other:
examples: Lizzie and Tyler are on the outs again.

definitions.definition: used to add the meaning "not central" to nouns and adjectives:
examples: the outskirts of town (= the areas that form the edge of the town)
